title: Waistcoat, ca. 1795
medium: Technique: embroidered using satin, stem and knot stitches in twelve colors of silk; applique of silk plain weave and silk cord; three kinds of sequins (spangles,  paillettes), coils of wire, metal-wrapped silk (two kinds) and paste jewels on silk 7&1 sat
description: Gentleman's embroidered waistcoat with decoration centered below the straight pocket flaps.

tombstone.epitaph: Waistcoat, ca. 1795.Technique: embroidered using satin, stem and knot stitches in twelve colors of silk; applique of silk plain weave and silk cord; three kinds of sequins (spangles,  paillettes), coils of wire, metal-wrapped silk (two kinds) and paste jewels on silk 7&1 sat. 1903-15-2.
